data.title: Top Songs of 1979
data.meta_description: All US top 40 singles for 1979 including drops, power hits and debuts. Notable artists include Elton John, Donna Summer, Cheap Trick, The Village People...
data.text:
Did you enjoy this 1979 Music Through the Years Video above? Then be sure to subscribe to subscribe to our YouTube channel to see all of our Top40Weekly videos!

In 1979, the chart-topping hits captivated audiences worldwide, defining the musical landscape of the era. From disco anthems to rock ballads, the top songs of that year showcased an eclectic mix of genres and styles, leaving an indelible mark on pop culture.

These are all the Top Songs of 1979.

*Note: Based on the Nolan Method, these are the year-end songs that represented the best songs of 1979. The Nolan Method ranking system was formulated by lead Top40Weekly contributor Jarrett Nolan and is based on a point system for an artist’s chart performance on Billboard charts.

Be sure to check out our Year in Music snapshot of what was happening in the world of Top 40 music in this decade.

Written by radio and music industry veteran Ed Osborne, each overview highlights the important trends and some of the representative songs and artists that shaped the music landscape and occupied the Top 40 charts during this decade of music.
